content.question:
The epidermal growth factor receptor <math alttext="E G F R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>EGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is a cell surface receptor. When a growth factor binds to <math alttext="E G F R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>EGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the receptor is activated. The activated <math alttext="E G F R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>EGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> triggers a signal transduction pathway, which leads to increased frequency of cell division.
Which of the following best predicts the effect of a mutation that causes <math alttext="E G F R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>EGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to be active in the absence of a growth factor?

choices.label: Increased apoptosis will lead to abnormal growth of the tissue.
Increased cell division will lead to the formation of a tumor.

Cells will exit the cell cycle, entering a non-dividing <math alttext="G 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> phase.
Fewer cells will be in any of the stages of mitosis.

content.answer: Increased cell division will lead to the formation of a tumor.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
